oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pamphlets
Scopes, John Thomas; Rhea County (Tenn.); Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Crowd gathers as the first shipment of booklets titled, "Why Dayton of all Places," by F. Robinson and W. Morgan arrive in Dayton.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Copies of the booklets were sold at Robinson's Drugstore on Main Street. Robinson's drugstore went out of business in 1982. Frank Robinson, the owner of the store and head of the county board of education, attempted to capitalize on the trial by; advertising his drugstore as the place "where it started."
